line_1: Thou glorious Ruler of the beauteous Day!
line_2: Have sev'nteen Years so swiftly roll'd away?

line_1: Have sev'nteen Years so swiftly roll'd away?
line_2: Thou glorious Ruler of the beauteous Day!

line_1: Hast thou so oft the heav'nly Circle run,
line_2: When scarce I thought thy radiant Course begun?

line_1: When scarce I thought thy radiant Course begun?
line_2: Hast thou so oft the heav'nly Circle run,

line_1: Never shall I my fleeting Time renew?
line_2: Must it all perish in one transient View?

line_1: Must it all perish in one transient View?
line_2: Never shall I my fleeting Time renew?

line_1: I wish — Alas! my Wishes are in vain:
line_2: Those flying Years they never can regain:

line_1: Those flying Years they never can regain:
line_2: I wish — Alas! my Wishes are in vain:

line_1: With rapid Haste Old Time the Moments drives;
line_2: And scarce a Trace of Youth in Age survives:

line_1: And scarce a Trace of Youth in Age survives:
line_2: With rapid Haste Old Time the Moments drives;

line_1: So, when the weary'd Mortal sinks to Rest,
line_2: And ev'ry Tumult ceases in his Breast;

line_1: And ev'ry Tumult ceases in his Breast;
line_2: So, when the weary'd Mortal sinks to Rest,

line_1: Imagin'd Scenes, and wish'd-for Views arise;
line_2: Anew Creation feeds his wond'ring Eyes;

line_1: Anew Creation feeds his wond'ring Eyes;
line_2: Imagin'd Scenes, and wish'd-for Views arise;

line_1: Till Phoebus, rising o'er the spangled Plain,
line_2: Recalls him from the bright, delusive Scene;

line_1: Recalls him from the bright, delusive Scene;
line_2: Till Phoebus, rising o'er the spangled Plain,

line_1: With Grief he then perceives th' enchanting Sight,
line_2: The fleeting Creature of oblivious Night.

line_1: The fleeting Creature of oblivious Night.
line_2: With Grief he then perceives th' enchanting Sight,

line_1: When some fine Voice delights the raptur'd Heart,
line_2: By Nature pleasing, yet improv'd by Art;

line_1: By Nature pleasing, yet improv'd by Art;
line_2: When some fine Voice delights the raptur'd Heart,

line_1: Tho' trembling each Seraphic Sound decay,
line_2: And with melodious Cadence melt away;

line_1: And with melodious Cadence melt away;
line_2: Tho' trembling each Seraphic Sound decay,

line_1: The faithful Echo still revives the Strain,
line_2: And sweetly charms the list'ning Ear again:

line_1: And sweetly charms the list'ning Ear again:
line_2: The faithful Echo still revives the Strain,

line_1: But Life, once vanish'd, will return no more;
line_2: No mimic Thought its Presence can restore.

line_1: No mimic Thought its Presence can restore.
line_2: But Life, once vanish'd, will return no more;

line_1: Say then, my Soul, how must I now survey
line_2: So many Years, so quickly snatch'd away?

line_1: So many Years, so quickly snatch'd away?
line_2: Say then, my Soul, how must I now survey

line_1: Awake, my Muse! Thou only canst impart
line_2: Ease to my Griefs, and heal the wounded Heart:

line_1: Ease to my Griefs, and heal the wounded Heart:
line_2: Awake, my Muse! Thou only canst impart

line_1: What Theme shall now employ my youthful Lays?
line_2: Say! Next to Heav'n, what Subject claims my Praise?

line_1: Say! Next to Heav'n, what Subject claims my Praise?
line_2: What Theme shall now employ my youthful Lays?

line_1: O impious Question! Dare I ask the Theme,
line_2: When a lov'd Parent does that Duty claim?

line_1: When a lov'd Parent does that Duty claim?
line_2: O impious Question! Dare I ask the Theme,

line_1: The Infant Tree, that, with judicious Care,
line_2: Some Hand defended from the piercing Air,

line_1: Some Hand defended from the piercing Air,
line_2: The Infant Tree, that, with judicious Care,

line_1: With cooling Streams reliev'd the burning Root,
line_2: Or lopp'd, with tender Skill, each sickly Shoot,

line_1: Or lopp'd, with tender Skill, each sickly Shoot,
line_2: With cooling Streams reliev'd the burning Root,

line_1: Soon as it learns the Tempest to despise,
line_2: And with diffusive Branches hide the Skies,

line_1: And with diffusive Branches hide the Skies,
line_2: Soon as it learns the Tempest to despise,

line_1: Gladly rewards the weary'd Peasant's Pains,
line_2: And loads the Parent Hand with annual Gains.

line_1: And loads the Parent Hand with annual Gains.
line_2: Gladly rewards the weary'd Peasant's Pains,

line_1: Haste then, my Muse; Sapphira is the Theme;
line_2: O strive, tho' vainly, to enhance her Fame:

line_1: O strive, tho' vainly, to enhance her Fame:
line_2: Haste then, my Muse; Sapphira is the Theme;

line_1: Her Guardian Care did all my Griefs assuage,
line_2: Those sure Attendants of an Infant Age!

line_1: Those sure Attendants of an Infant Age!
line_2: Her Guardian Care did all my Griefs assuage,

line_1: By her conducted to the Light of Truth,
line_2: I sail, unshipwreck'd, thro' the Storm of Youth:

line_1: I sail, unshipwreck'd, thro' the Storm of Youth:
line_2: By her conducted to the Light of Truth,

line_1: The heav'nly Influence of her sage Advice
line_2: Points from afar the dang'rous Rocks of Vice;

line_1: Points from afar the dang'rous Rocks of Vice;
line_2: The heav'nly Influence of her sage Advice

line_1: Shews, with discerning Eye, the blissful Plains,
line_2: Where Peace, eternal, with fair Virtue reigns.

line_1: Where Peace, eternal, with fair Virtue reigns.
line_2: Shews, with discerning Eye, the blissful Plains,

line_1: O Thou, whom ev'ry Grace and Worth attends,
line_2: Thou best of Mothers, and thou best of Friends,

line_1: Thou best of Mothers, and thou best of Friends,
line_2: O Thou, whom ev'ry Grace and Worth attends,

line_1: Indulgently accept these filial Lays;
line_2: Accept thy Son's inartificial Praise:

line_1: Accept thy Son's inartificial Praise:
line_2: Indulgently accept these filial Lays;

line_1: May Heav'n restore thee to these Eyes again,
line_2: And safely waft thee o'er th' Iernian Main:

line_1: And safely waft thee o'er th' Iernian Main:
line_2: May Heav'n restore thee to these Eyes again,

line_1: O quickly to my longing Eyes repair,
line_2: And ever bless me with thy Guardian Care!

line_1: And ever bless me with thy Guardian Care!
line_2: O quickly to my longing Eyes repair,

line_1: Tho' the Plumb, and the Peach, with Apollo conspire,
line_2: To present you their Softness, and Sweetness, and Fire;

line_1: To present you their Softness, and Sweetness, and Fire;
line_2: Tho' the Plumb, and the Peach, with Apollo conspire,

line_1: Their Aid is in vain; for what can they do,
line_2: But blush, and confess them selves vanquish'd by you?

line_1: But blush, and confess them selves vanquish'd by you?
line_2: Their Aid is in vain; for what can they do,

line_1: Where Virtue and Wit with such Qualities blend,
line_2: What Mortal, what Goddess, would dare to contend?

line_1: What Mortal, what Goddess, would dare to contend?
line_2: Where Virtue and Wit with such Qualities blend,

line_1: As thro' this sylvan Scene I stray'd,
line_2: I saw and lov'd the Iv'ry Maid:

line_1: I saw and lov'd the Iv'ry Maid:
line_2: As thro' this sylvan Scene I stray'd,

line_1: And hearing that she fled from Man,
line_2: I begg'd this Form of mighty Pan;

line_1: I begg'd this Form of mighty Pan;
line_2: And hearing that she fled from Man,

line_1: To try, by ev'ry winning Art,
line_2: To gain Possession of her Heart;

line_1: To gain Possession of her Heart;
line_2: To try, by ev'ry winning Art,

line_1: When raging Tempests cloud the Sky,
line_2: Transported at her Feet to lie;

line_1: Transported at her Feet to lie;
line_2: When raging Tempests cloud the Sky,

line_1: When Phoebus brightens up the Weather,
line_2: To trip it o'er the Lawns together.

line_1: To trip it o'er the Lawns together.
line_2: When Phoebus brightens up the Weather,

line_1: See, the bright Sun renews his annual Course,
line_2: Each Beam re-tinges, and revives its Force,

line_1: Each Beam re-tinges, and revives its Force,
line_2: See, the bright Sun renews his annual Course,

line_1: By Years uninjur'd; so may'st thou remain,
line_2: Not Time from thee, but thou from Time may'st gain:

line_1: Not Time from thee, but thou from Time may'st gain:
line_2: By Years uninjur'd; so may'st thou remain,

line_1: O might the Fates thy vital Thread prolong,
line_2: And make thy Life immortal, as thy Song!

line_1: And make thy Life immortal, as thy Song!
line_2: O might the Fates thy vital Thread prolong,

line_1: Less Lustre waits the God, when he refines
line_2: The rip'ning Metal in Peruvian Mines;

line_1: The rip'ning Metal in Peruvian Mines;
line_2: Less Lustre waits the God, when he refines

line_1: Brightens the Crystal with transparent Day,
line_2: Or points the Di'mond with its sparkling Ray;

line_1: Or points the Di'mond with its sparkling Ray;
line_2: Brightens the Crystal with transparent Day,

line_1: Than when, delighted, he thy Soul inspires,
line_2: Informs thy Judgment, and thy Fancy fires;

line_1: Informs thy Judgment, and thy Fancy fires;
line_2: Than when, delighted, he thy Soul inspires,

line_1: Assists thee striking out some bold Design,
line_2: And breathes immortal Honours on each Line:

line_1: And breathes immortal Honours on each Line:
line_2: Assists thee striking out some bold Design,

line_1: In common as His Rays on all descend,
line_2: So You the Great delight, the Poor befriend:

line_1: So You the Great delight, the Poor befriend:
line_2: In common as His Rays on all descend,

line_1: As Heat productive His bright Beams bestow,
line_2: So, warm with Life, your pow'rful Numbers flow:

line_1: So, warm with Life, your pow'rful Numbers flow:
line_2: As Heat productive His bright Beams bestow,

line_1: As He from Clouds bursts forth divinely bright,
line_2: So Envy sets You in a fairer Light:

line_1: So Envy sets You in a fairer Light:
line_2: As He from Clouds bursts forth divinely bright,

line_1: Yet, tho' thus far Similitude we see,
line_2: One Thing disturbs the wond'rous Harmony;

line_1: One Thing disturbs the wond'rous Harmony;
line_2: Yet, tho' thus far Similitude we see,

line_1: With faded Light the Winter Sun appears,
line_2: Whilst You shine brighter in Decline of Years.

line_1: Whilst You shine brighter in Decline of Years.
line_2: With faded Light the Winter Sun appears,

line_1: May each new Year some new Perfection give,
line_2: Till all the Mother in the Daughter live!

line_1: Till all the Mother in the Daughter live!
line_2: May each new Year some new Perfection give,

line_1: May'st Thou her Virtues to the World restore!
line_2: And be what Henrietta was before!

line_1: And be what Henrietta was before!
line_2: May'st Thou her Virtues to the World restore!

line_1: And when revolving Years mature thy Charms,
line_2: When Pride of Conquest thy fair Bosom warms,

line_1: When Pride of Conquest thy fair Bosom warms,
line_2: And when revolving Years mature thy Charms,

line_1: May some great Youth, for ev'ry Grace renown'd,
line_2: With Taste and Science bless'd, by Virtue crown'd;

line_1: With Taste and Science bless'd, by Virtue crown'd;
line_2: May some great Youth, for ev'ry Grace renown'd,

line_1: By Virtue guarded from Ambition's Wiles,
line_2: Superior both to Fortune's Frowns and Smiles;

line_1: Superior both to Fortune's Frowns and Smiles;
line_2: By Virtue guarded from Ambition's Wiles,

line_1: Who wears the Honours of a glorious Name,
line_2: Yet to Distinction bears a nobler Claim;

line_1: Yet to Distinction bears a nobler Claim;
line_2: Who wears the Honours of a glorious Name,

line_1: Like a new Star, in native Lustre bright,
line_2: That boasts no Radiance from reflected Light:

line_1: That boasts no Radiance from reflected Light:
line_2: Like a new Star, in native Lustre bright,

line_1: Allow'd the rising Genius of his Age;
line_2: By ev'ry Excellence thy Heart engage;

line_1: By ev'ry Excellence thy Heart engage;
line_2: Allow'd the rising Genius of his Age;

line_1: Like Him who bless'd thy Mother's Nuptial State;
line_2: But O! may Heav'n give Thine a longer Date.

line_1: But O! may Heav'n give Thine a longer Date.
line_2: Like Him who bless'd thy Mother's Nuptial State;
